articles.content_full:
England captain Ben Stokes has called for his team to show raw fight and aggression to salvage the Ashes series. Trailing Australia 2-0 after two eight-wicket losses, England faces a must-win third Test. Stokes emphasized a dog mentality, urging his players to unleash an inner toughness on the field.
England Seeks Urgency After Two Losses
England’s Ashes campaign is in deep trouble, with the team down 2-0 to Australia in the 2025-26 series. Both opening Tests concluded with eight-wicket defeats for England. This comes ahead of the critical third Test in Adelaide, set to start on Wednesday.
Stakes Are High for Decisive Third Test
The upcoming match in Adelaide is now a do-or-die fixture for England. A loss would mean surrendering the Ashes urn to Australia. England made one change to its starting XI, bringing in fast bowler Josh Tongue to replace Gus Atkinson, as reported by ESPN. Despite a pitch expected to favor spin, England opted not to include Shoaib Bashir in the XI.
Batting Struggles Define England’s Start
England’s top seven batsmen, including Stokes himself, have struggled to score consistently. Stokes averaged under 30 across his four innings in the series so far. Only his second-innings half-century in Brisbane offered significant resistance. In the second Test, England resumed a seventh-wicket stand that yielded 96 runs from 221 deliveries before Australia secured the win. Will Jacks scored 19 in the first innings, contributing to a 40-run partnership with Joe Root. He added 41 runs alongside Stokes in the second innings, forcing Australia to bat again to chase 65 for victory.
Stokes Calls for Greater Fight
Ben Stokes directly challenged his team to display more aggression and mental fortitude. He pointed to his own resistance and Jofra Archer’s fastest spells as examples of the required mindset. Stokes said he could have “nicked off first ball” in Brisbane but chose to bat with a different mentality, describing this as true fight, according to ESPN. This call for fight echoes Jofra Archer’s own “lost cause” response in Brisbane, where Archer delivered one of his fastest spells for England. Stokes has lit a “fire under his charges” for what he considers the “biggest match of his tenure,” emphasizing resistance similar to the Jacks partnership.

“I could have gone out there on that morning session in Brisbane and nicked off first ball, but going out there with that mentality and that mindset is what fight is to me.”

Stokes spoke to ESPN, outlining his expectation for the team. He also highlighted Jofra Archer’s intense bowling during a previous match, stating he asked Archer “to really turn it on.”

“That was one of those moments when I asked him to really turn it on… a really, really important moment for us in the series.”

Stokes recounted this instruction for Archer’s performance, which he felt was unfairly criticized at the time as a “lost cause” despite his high speeds. Head coach Brendon McCullum publicly backed the faltering top seven over the weekend, reaffirming confidence in the batting group.
What’s Next for England
The third Ashes Test begins Wednesday in Adelaide. England needs a win to keep their hopes of reclaiming the Ashes alive. Josh Tongue will join the bowling attack, likely partnering Jofra Archer and Brydon Carse. Will Jacks retains his primary spin option role for England, despite Shoaib Bashir’s omission for this Test. Stokes has reaffirmed Bashir’s status, even after his recent form of 2/151 against the Lions and 0/115 against Australia A, as noted in a recent report. Stokes urged the entire batting group, including himself, to correct their mistakes in this pivotal match.

Nathan Lyon has re-entered Australia’s Test cricket squad for the upcoming Adelaide match, focusing on the team’s objective. This selection comes at a critical juncture for the Ashes series. The conditions in Adelaide are predicted to be advantageous for his style of bowling.

Lyon’s selection directly impacts Australia’s strategy for the Adelaide Test. His spin expertise provides a significant advantage on a pitch designed to turn. This tactical move signals a clear intent to dominate the English batsmen.
The dry wicket conditions are historically known to aid spinners in extracting greater turn and bounce. Such conditions amplify Nathan Lyon’s impact, making him a central figure in Australia’s bowling plans. The potential for a 3-0 Ashes sweep hinges partly on this strategic choice, according to insights from the team’s camp.
Crafting a Clean Sweep
Australia’s pursuit of a 3-0 Ashes clean sweep adds immense pressure and significance to this match. A dominant victory would underscore their superiority in the historic rivalry. Lyon’s role is not just about individual performance but contributing to this overarching team goal. The short-term implications influence immediate team selection and on-field tactics.

This motivational stance highlights his focus on the task ahead, as he shared in a recent interview. His reintegration seems marked by personal conviction.

The Minnesota Timberwolves defeated the Sacramento Kings 117-103 at Target Center on December 14, 2025. This victory highlighted a brilliant offensive balance from the  short-handed Timberwolves, despite missing key players. The team’s cohesive play secured their 16th win of the season, solidifying their position in the Western Conference standings.
Game Summary and Timberwolves’ Balance
Minnesota controlled the game against the Kings, concluding with a decisive 117-103 score. Julius Randle led the Timberwolves’ charge, contributing 24 points and grabbing 9 rebounds. The team showcased significant depth, effectively distributing scoring responsibilities across the roster. The detailed box score, available via ESPN Africa, confirms comprehensive player statistics for the contest.
The Timberwolves’ performance at home remains strong, now boasting an 8-4 record. This contrasts sharply with the Kings’ struggles on the road, where they have managed only 3 wins against 11 losses. Minnesota also dominated the boards, securing a 10-rebound advantage over Sacramento during the game. Early in the contest, the Timberwolves launched an 18-7 run, setting an aggressive tone and demonstrating strong ball movement. This balanced attack allowed them to maintain control throughout the matchup, even without a full complement of players.
Kings’ Injury Setback
The Sacramento Kings faced a significant setback beyond the loss itself. Their leading scorer, Zach LaVine, exited the game early due to an ankle injury. LaVine had only recently returned to action after missing seven games, adding drama to the Kings’ night. His early departure undoubtedly impacted Sacramento’s offensive flow, as ESPN reported his injury during the game.
The Void Left by LaVine
LaVine’s absence created a considerable void for the Kings. He averages 20.6 points per game, shooting 48.6% from the field and 86.6% from the free-throw line. Losing such a productive offensive force, especially after a recent return from a seven-game absence, forced the Kings to adjust their strategy on the fly. This injury adds to a challenging season for Sacramento, as their record now stands at 6-19, placing them 13th in the Western Conference. His consistent scoring is a crucial component that the Kings will need to address in his potential absence.
Key Player Contributions
Anthony Edwards delivered a relentless offensive performance for the Timberwolves. He provided consistent scoring, knocking down multiple three-pointers throughout the game. Edwards also facilitated plays, dishing out assists to players like Rudy “Goar” (Gobert) for easy buckets around the rim. His physical dominance and comprehensive play were evident throughout the contest. Simulated streams highlighted Edwards’ comprehensive scoring and rebounding edges, as seen on YouTube’s game analysis.
The team’s ability to maintain high energy and execute precise plays, even when short-handed, was a key factor in their victory. Edwards’ ability to both score and create opportunities for teammates epitomized the offensive balance Minnesota achieved. His contributions were a critical element in overcoming any roster limitations, ensuring the team’s offense remained potent and unpredictable. Randle’s double-digit scoring and nearly double-digit rebounding further solidified the Timberwolves’ interior presence and secondary scoring options, allowing the team to thrive despite missing personnel.

“Edwards is a true scoring machine, showcasing physical dominance throughout the game.”

Simulated commentary during the broadcast described Anthony Edwards this way, according to various online streams. This observation underscores the consistent impact Edwards had on the game, driving Minnesota’s offense with both his individual scoring and dynamic playmaking. His performance was a central theme for those observing the game’s unfolding action.
What’s Next for the Western Conference Teams
The Timberwolves’ latest victory reinforces their position in the playoff hunt, currently holding 6th place in the Western Conference. Their strong home performance and ability to win short-handed are positive indicators for the remainder of the season. For the Kings, LaVine’s injury will likely force short-term tactical adjustments and roster considerations. The full impact of his ankle injury remains to be seen, as ESPN’s game recap detailed the immediate fallout from the contest and its implications for both teams’ trajectories moving forward.

articles.content_full:
The New Orleans Pelicans claimed a 114-104 victory over the Chicago Bulls on December 14, 2025. Rookie guard Jeremiah Fears gave the Pelicans a glimpse of the future, delivering key plays in a crucial road win. This rare win helped New Orleans secure their first two-game winning streak of the challenging season.
Game Details and a Fourth-Quarter Surge
The Pelicans overcame an early deficit at the United Center, battling back from a 21-26 first-quarter score against the Bulls. New Orleans showed resilience in the second quarter, outscoring Chicago 31-21 to take a 52-47 lead into halftime. The Bulls pushed back in the third, controlling the quarter 28-24, leaving New Orleans with a slim 76-75 advantage heading into the final period.
The fourth quarter proved decisive, with the Pelicans finding an offensive rhythm and pulling away. They outscored Chicago 38-29 in the final twelve minutes, highlighting improved efficiency and composure under pressure. A pivotal 13-foot step-back jumpshot from Jeremiah Fears stood out, shifting momentum and demonstrating his clutch potential, as ESPN reported. Other key moments included a 1-foot dunk by Bulls’ Saddiq Bey and Fears’ earlier missed finger roll layup, which showed his aggressive playmaking attempts.
Fears’ Impact Amidst Team Struggles
Jeremiah Fears, wearing #0 off the bench, featured prominently in the Pelicans’ win. His performance provided a significant bright spot for a team currently facing a challenging 5-22 overall record. This two-game streak, while modest, offers a sliver of much-needed positive momentum in what has been a difficult season for New Orleans. The victory leaves them 14 games back in the Southwest Division standings.
Fears’ ability to hit clutch shots, particularly his step-back jumper, demonstrated his potential as a future offensive threat for New Orleans. For a team anchored by established players like Zion Williamson, the emergence of a promising rookie like Fears offers a tangible reason for optimism. His presence on the court underscored his readiness to contribute in high-pressure situations, even with a minor miscue like his missed finger roll earlier in the game.
Fears Signals Future Potential
The Pelicans have struggled to find consistent offensive rhythm and identity throughout this season. Fears’ ability to create his own shot and convert crucial points in a tight fourth quarter suggests he could be a valuable asset for the franchise moving forward. This performance will likely prompt the coaching staff to consider his role moving ahead, potentially increasing his minutes or responsibilities. His dynamic plays inject a much-needed burst of energy into a team needing every spark it can find.
No Immediate Reactions, But Implications Are Clear
No direct quotes from players, coaches, or analysts emerged immediately after the game. However, the game narrative itself, particularly the focus on Fears’ key shots and the Pelicans’ fourth-quarter surge, implies a positive internal reaction regarding his potential contributions. The win, breaking a long dry spell for consistent success, surely brought a sense of relief and renewed focus to the Pelicans’ locker room.
For the Bulls, the 104-114 loss drops their record to 10-15, extending their losing streak to one game. This places them firmly in the mid-pack of the Central Division, 10 games behind the division leaders. Their inability to hold a lead in the fourth quarter against a struggling Pelicans team highlights areas needing significant improvement. The game’s outcome suggests a need for Chicago to reassess their late-game execution, as the official box score confirmed.
Looking Ahead for Both Teams
The Pelicans’ rare two-game winning streak provides minor momentum as they continue their arduous season. While specific upcoming fixtures were not detailed, this hard-fought win against the Bulls offers a psychological boost. Jeremiah Fears’ emergence signals potential lineup tweaks and a slightly brighter long-term outlook for the team, despite their deep hole in the standings. His performance could influence coaching decisions, potentially leading to increased playing time in upcoming games, providing him with more opportunities to develop.
The Bulls, meanwhile, will feel added pressure from this loss as they navigate a competitive Central Division. Their next games will be crucial for maintaining their playoff hopes and correcting the fourth-quarter lapses seen against New Orleans.
This result, though a small step, could be a vital building block for New Orleans. It validates the potential of their younger players, including Fears, and offers a renewed sense of purpose. The team aims to build on this rare success, with Fears at the forefront of their future hopes, as the game’s statistics underline. The path remains long, but a clear sign of progress has appeared, giving fans something to look forward to, as ESPN’s coverage detailed.

articles.content_full:
Mumbai staged a remarkable chase in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2025-26 Super League, defeating Haryana by six wickets in Pune. Chasing a formidable 235 runs, Mumbai relied on a spectacular Jaiswal ton and a rapid Sarfaraz fifty to secure the victory. The defending champions bounced back strongly from their previous loss to Hyderabad.
Mumbai Dominates Record Chase in Pune
Mumbai opted to bowl first against Haryana in their Super League encounter. Haryana’s batting lineup posted a challenging total of 235 runs, setting a demanding target for Mumbai. Ankit Kumar was the chief architect of Haryana’s innings, scoring a blistering 89 runs off just 42 balls. This knock stood as a joint-highest T20 score for the batter, pushing Haryana to a strong position. Samant Jakhar also contributed effectively, adding 31 runs from only 14 deliveries before retiring hurt during the innings. These performances highlighted Haryana’s aggressive approach and their ability to put runs on the board.
Mumbai’s bowlers faced a tough challenge on what appeared to be a small ground in Pune, conducive to high scoring. Sairaj Patil managed to pick up two crucial wickets for 44 runs for Mumbai. Shardul Thakur bowled a tight spell, attempting to contain Haryana’s free-flowing scoring. Despite their efforts, Haryana amassed a significant total, leaving Mumbai with a formidable chase ahead, as detailed by ESPNcricinfo.
Jaiswal and Sarfaraz Lead the Charge
Mumbai’s response to the challenging target was both aggressive and calculated. Yashasvi Jaiswal spearheaded the chase with an exceptional century. He reached 100 runs from just 48 balls, an innings punctuated by 16 fours and one six. This marks Jaiswal’s fourth T20 century, underscoring his consistent power-hitting ability in the format. His early onslaught ensured Mumbai kept pace with the required run rate from the outset.
Jaiswal found an explosive partner in Sarfaraz Khan, who provided critical acceleration in the middle overs. Sarfaraz hammered 64 runs off just 25 deliveries, an innings that included nine fours and three sixes. Together, Jaiswal and Sarfaraz forged a devastating 88-run second-wicket partnership. This crucial stand developed rapidly, taking only 37 balls to reach its conclusion and significantly shifting the momentum in Mumbai’s favor. The rapid scoring rate put Haryana’s bowlers under immense pressure, making it difficult for them to stem the flow of boundaries.
Finishing Strong and Key Contributions
The partnership between Jaiswal and Sarfaraz was a masterclass in T20 batting, combining controlled aggression with decisive stroke play. Jaiswal’s ability to find gaps and clear the ropes regularly kept the scoreboard ticking. Sarfaraz’s quickfire innings ensured there was no dip in the scoring rate, even with such a large target in sight. Ajinkya Rahane also contributed to the chase, scoring a brisk 21 runs off 10 balls, adding valuable runs at a high strike rate.
Even as Jaiswal holed out with just seven runs remaining for victory, Mumbai maintained their composure. Atharva Ankolekar stepped up to complete the chase. He finished unbeaten, hitting a six and a four to seal the win. Mumbai reached 236 for four, securing the victory with six wickets still in hand. The successful chase demonstrated Mumbai’s deep batting lineup and their ability to handle pressure in high-stakes matches, as reported by ESPNcricinfo. Spectators can relive the excitement of Jaiswal’s powerful hitting through match highlights available on YouTube.
Momentum Shift and IPL Implications
This victory is a significant morale booster for Mumbai, who are the defending champions in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. They had experienced a setback with a loss to Hyderabad just a day earlier, making this commanding chase a crucial rebound. The team’s ability to overcome a substantial target underscores their strength and determination in the Super League. Mumbai now carries renewed momentum forward in the tournament, reaffirming their status as a contender.
The individual performances in such high-scoring domestic T20 matches hold considerable importance for players, especially with upcoming auctions. Sarfaraz Khan’s explosive 64-run innings, alongside his earlier 47-ball fifty, significantly boosts his prospects for the IPL 2026 auction. As a capped batter, strong and consistent performances in tournaments like the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy directly enhance his market value.
Franchises closely monitor such displays of power-hitting and composure under pressure, as highlighted by ESPNcricinfo coverage of key domestic T20 recovery for Mumbai stars. His ability to deliver under pressure makes him an attractive asset for any team looking to strengthen their batting lineup.

articles.content_full:
A Big Bash League (BBL) fan at Docklands Stadium pulled off what many are calling the Best crowd catch EVER? during Friday night’s BBL|15 opener in Melbourne. The Melbourne Renegades supporter made an incredible one-handed grab of a towering six, all while keeping his full beer upright in his other hand. The moment, featuring Sydney Thunder opener Matt Short’s powerful hit, instantly went viral, capturing global attention.
Match Night Miracle in Melbourne
The unforgettable moment occurred around 9:45 PM local AEDT (10:45 AM UTC) on December 14, 2025, during the 7th over of the Sydney Thunder’s innings. Thunder opener Matt Short, in dominant form, launched a 92-meter six towards the front row of the sold-out Docklands Stadium, which hosted 18,000 fans. A quick-thinking Renegades fan, later dubbed “Beer Guy” across social media, executed a stunning one-handed catch. Remarkably, he kept his beverage perfectly still in his other hand, not spilling a single drop.
The Renegades’ official X account quickly reacted, retweeting fan footage and simply stating: “Our legend in the crowd! 🥤🏏 #BeerCatch.”
The match itself saw the Thunder chase down the Melbourne Renegades’ total of 155/7 in 20 overs. Tom Rogers top-scored for the Renegades with 52 runs, while Kane Richardson took 3/28 for the Thunder. The Thunder secured victory, reaching 157/3 in just 17.2 overs, with Matt Short remaining unbeaten on 68* from 45 balls (including 7 fours and 3 sixes) and Oliver Davies contributing 40*. Despite the Renegades’ season-opening loss, the fan’s athletic feat became the undeniable highlight, overshadowing the scoreboard for many observers.
The Catch Goes Global
Social media exploded with reactions immediately after the catch. Hashtags like #BeerCatch surged, trending #3 Australia-wide with 450K posts within hours. Globally, #BestCrowdCatchWW garnered 120K posts. The official BBL account on X declared: “Crowd MVP! 🍻“, attracting 150K likes. Instagram Reels featuring the incredible grab accumulated over 5 million views.
Celebrities also joined in, with Hugh Jackman posting on X: “Aussie legend! 🍻🇦🇺” to 2 million likes, and Chris Hemsworth reposting the moment on Instagram. International media, including Marca in Spain (“Australiano salva cerveza y cricket”) and L’Equipe in France (“Attrape miracle!”), quickly picked up the story, highlighting the catch’s universal appeal.
Why This Catch Stands Out
The precision and casual execution of the catch have cemented its place as a truly unique moment in cricket history. Stadium replay analysis revealed the fan’s reaction time was approximately 0.4 seconds to secure the ball, which was caught at a height of 2.1 meters. This remarkable grab, occurring just 1 meter behind the boundary rope, prevented additional runs and potential interference, adding a layer of practical impact beyond its sheer entertainment value. According to ESPN Cricinfo, it ranks as the fourth-longest BBL crowd six-catch on record. Its distinction, however, lies squarely in the “beer factor” – the unparalleled composure of holding a full drink without a spill.
Historically, the BBL has celebrated other memorable crowd catches, such as the 2019 Perth “pizza catch.” Globally, this moment draws comparisons to the IPL 2022 “samosa save.” However, the specific combination of a one-handed, clean grab with an untouched, full beverage sets this catch apart.
The tactical decision by the Thunder to target the short boundary on the fan’s side underscored the power of Short’s hitting. Novelty prop bets on a crowd catch, which had odds as high as 20-1 on Bet365, paid out, underscoring the rarity and unexpected nature of the event. This incident also perfectly embodies the “Aussie larrikin spirit,” uniting sports fans across cricket and Australian Rules Football during the Test summer.

“I smashed it, thought it was gone, then this bloke plucks it one-handed with a beer? Absolute legend. Buy him a round!”

Gutted we lost, but that catch had the whole ground roaring.” BBL CEO Alison Emmerson highlighted the broader significance of such moments in an official statement: “Moments like this are why we love cricket—pure joy.” Even the Renegades locker room, though “flat,” was reportedly “laughing” about the catch, as revealed by a player’s Instagram story.
Expert analysis quickly followed. Ex-Aussie paceman Brett Lee remarked on Fox Sports, “Fielding coaches take note—instinct like that wins Ashes.” Tim Wigmore of The Athletic added that the catch “elevates BBL’s entertainment edge over IPL.” Fan sentiment was overwhelmingly positive across platforms, with Sky Sports X polls indicating 87% of respondents considered it the “Best ever.” The fan, later identified by local radio as “Dave from Footscray,” captured the national mood with his reported stadium mic comment: “Mate, reflex—beer was safe priority!”

The “Beer Guy” is now a sporting icon. The BBL has extended an invitation for him to attend the Renegades’ next home game against the Stars on December 17. This event has already spurred increased ticket demand, with Ticketek data showing a 15% rise for upcoming Renegades home matches. Beer sponsor XXXX is projected to see a 20% spike in stadium sales, leveraging the viral moment, and “Beer Catch” themed merchandise is rapidly selling out online. This incident boosts Matt Short’s profile, generating buzz ahead of the IPL auction in February 2026.
Long-term, this moment reinforces the BBL’s “fun-first” pivot, helping to differentiate the league in the competitive T20 cricket market. The Thunder, now 1-0 and topping the table, will carry significant momentum into their December 20 clash against the Perth Scorchers. The rematch between the Renegades and Thunder on January 8 is already anticipated, with expectations of “Beer Guy” tributes.
BBC Sport predicts continued fan engagement, forecasting over 2 million #BeerCatch posts by the end of the week. This unique fan moment could even lead to the “Beer Guy” becoming an unofficial mascot, further solidifying the BBL’s reputation for spontaneous, entertaining spectacle.

Matchday 15 Beckons for Juventus

Ownership Rejects €1 Billion Takeover Bid
Just hours before the Bologna match, Juventus owners publicly rejected a substantial takeover bid. Exor, the holding company of the Agnelli family, turned down a €1 billion ($1.2 billion) offer from cryptocurrency firm Tether on December 13, 2025. This decision ensures the Agnelli family maintains control, explicitly rejecting the trend of foreign investment seen in other Italian giants like AC Milan and Inter Milan. The news, reported by multiple outlets, arrived as the team geared up for its Serie A fixture.
A Century of Commitment
The Agnelli family’s connection to Juventus spans over a century, establishing a deep-rooted legacy. This long-standing commitment was underscored by recent statements from the ownership. John Elkann, the Juventus owner, affirmed, “We continue to support our squad and are looking toward the future in order to build a winning Juve.”
Exor further reiterated its stance, stating, “Exor reaffirms its previous, consistent statements that it has no intention of selling any of its shares in Juventus to a third party… Juventus is a storied and successful club, of which Exor and the Agnelli family are the stable and proud shareholders for over a century, and they remain fully committed to the club, supporting its new management team in the execution of a clear strategy to deliver strong results both on and off the field.”
This strong endorsement of stability and future vision provides a clear backdrop for the team’s ongoing efforts on the field, a sentiment echoed across various fan discussions online.

The Bologna match serves as an immediate test for Luciano Spalletti’s burgeoning strategy. His appointment last month followed Igor Tudor’s dismissal, signaling a fresh start for the Bianconeri. The ownership’s recent pledge of “full support” for squad rebuilding aligns directly with Spalletti’s task. Juventus aims to end a Serie A title drought that dates back to 2020, following nine consecutive championship wins between 2012 and 2020. This fixture is a critical step in restoring the club’s legacy as 36-time champions, a challenge highlighted in match previews.

Immediate focus remains on the outcome of the Bologna match. This game offers the first real gauge of Spalletti’s new approach and its effectiveness. Short-term implications will likely include potential tactical adjustments based on the match performance.
Looking ahead, the club’s long-term goal is to continuously build a “winning Juve” and deliver “strong results both on and off the field,” as publicly supported by the ownership. The journey to reclaim Serie A dominance is a multi-season endeavor, with each match, including this one against Bologna, contributing to that larger strategy, as detailed in pre-game reports.

Names such as Jeremy Jacquet, Marc Guehi, and Nico Schlotterbeck are reportedly on their radar. The upcoming summer transfer window will be crucial in determining Konaté’s future at Liverpool. Transfer negotiations often accelerate closer to pre-season preparations, with clubs keen to integrate new signings early. Liverpool will likely move swiftly to secure any incoming defenders if a sale is imminent, ensuring the new manager has a full complement of players. The window itself presents several deadlines and milestones for clubs to navigate.
Fans will watch closely for any official announcements or further transfer developments as the window progresses. These reports indicate that no official announcements or team statements confirm any deal, highlighting the speculative nature of the news.
Dalot, 26, is a Portugal international known for his adaptability. He excels in both right-back and right wing-back roles. His current contract with Manchester United extends until 2028, with an option for an additional year. This lengthy contract provides United with strong leverage in any potential negotiations.

Dalot’s representatives have already approached Manchester United for new contract discussions. They are aware of the strong interest from several major European clubs. Real Madrid, along with Atletico Madrid and Bayern Munich, are mentioned as interested parties, according to discussions on various YouTube channels. These discussions from December 13-14, 2025, specifically on channels like Forever United TV, highlight the perceived “dilemma” facing United.
Manchester United is reportedly satisfied with Dalot’s on-field performances. However, extending his current deal would almost certainly require a substantial pay rise. This financial aspect adds another layer of complexity to his future at Old Trafford. Dalot’s value is tied directly to his existing contract, which runs for several more seasons.
Real Madrid’s interest comes despite their summer signing of Trent Alexander-Arnold. The Spanish giants are seeking to add depth and versatility to their defensive options. Their current right-back, Dani Carvajal, is 33 years old, prompting a need for future planning in that position. Dalot’s ability to cover multiple roles makes him an attractive target for a club like Madrid. The immediate next steps involve ongoing internal discussions at Manchester United, which are expected to continue into 2026. Dalot’s representatives are actively pushing for concrete contract discussions to begin in 2026. This timeline suggests no immediate move is expected.
A January transfer window departure for Dalot is not indicated by current reports. The focus for Dalot and United remains firmly on his performances throughout the current season. His consistent play will only strengthen his position, whether in renewed contract talks or on the transfer market.
In the long term, a potential switch to Real Madrid could materialize, driven by their need for versatility at right-back and the advancing age of Dani Carvajal. Should United decide against meeting Dalot’s contract demands, they would likely seek a substantial transfer fee.
This reflects broader industry trends where quality right-backs are in high demand, with clubs like Manchester City also reportedly eyeing other options in the market, as various reports suggest. The future of Diogo Dalot at Old Trafford will hinge on these upcoming internal negotiations and the persistence of interest from European giants.

The decisive match took place on December 13, 2025, at Ninja Stadium, also known as Bellerive Oval, in Hobart. This victory caps a dominant season for the Hurricanes, bringing a long-awaited championship to their home
articles.content_full:
The Hobart Hurricanes Women secured their first-ever Women’s Big Bash League title, defeating the Perth Scorchers Women by eight wickets in the WBBL|11 Final. The decisive match took place on December 13, 2025, at Ninja Stadium, also known as Bellerive Oval, in Hobart. Lizelle Lee led the chase with an unbeaten 77 runs, cementing the Hurricanes win maiden WBBL title after beating Scorchers. This victory caps a dominant season for the Hurricanes, bringing a long-awaited championship to their home crowd.
Final Showdown in Hobart
The Perth Scorchers batted first after winning the toss, posting a total of 137/5 from their 20 overs. Captain Sophie Devine was the top scorer for the Scorchers, contributing 34 runs. However, the Hurricanes’ bowlers exerted consistent pressure. Heather Graham proved to be a key performer, taking 2 wickets for 26 runs. Even more impactful was Linsey Smith, who delivered an exceptionally economical spell, claiming 2 wickets for just 8 runs from her four overs, a performance highlighted in the ESPN match report. The Scorchers’ innings struggled to find momentum against the disciplined attack.
The Hurricanes’ chase began with purpose, ultimately reaching 141/2 to secure the win with overs to spare. Lizelle Lee anchored the innings with a brilliant, unbeaten 77 runs. Her knock included crucial boundaries and smart running, putting the Hurricanes firmly in control.
Nat Sciver-Brunt provided excellent support, scoring 35 runs. Early on, Danni Wyatt contributed 16 runs before being bowled. The partnership between Lee and Sciver-Brunt built the foundation for victory, as Scorchers’ bowlers like Ainsworth (4-0-37-0) and Devine (2-0-9-0) found it difficult to break through the steady batting.
Lee’s Unbeaten Knock Secures History
Lizelle Lee’s performance was the cornerstone of the Hurricanes’ maiden title. Her unbeaten 77 runs marked her first half-century in a final, a truly match-defining innings under pressure. Commentary during the game lauded her chase, with phrases like “all aboard the K train… history in the making” and describing her effort as a “magnificent” run chase from a “pressure cooker” situation, as noted in YouTube highlights. This individual brilliance, combined with a cohesive team effort, saw the Hurricanes overcome the Scorchers, a team featuring strong players like captain Elyse Villani and wicketkeeper Beth Mooney.
Hurricanes’ Dominant Season Culmination
Hobart had a remarkably strong regular season, winning seven out of their ten games. They consistently demonstrated their ability to chase down formidable targets, including a prior chase of 189/3 against Perth. The Hurricanes topped the regular season standings, affording them a rest period before the final, while the Scorchers had to navigate through additional playoff matches. This fresh approach might have played a role in the final’s outcome.
The Bellerive Oval, also known as Ninja Stadium, historically favors pacers, with 64% of wickets falling to fast bowlers. However, the Hurricanes’ batters adapted effectively, ensuring their strong season culminated in a championship. The win marks a significant milestone, ending the Hurricanes’ title drought and igniting national pride for Hobart.
Fan Excitement and Global Reach
The victory sparked immediate and enthusiastic reactions from fans both locally and internationally. Social media was abuzz with celebrations, and highlights of the match quickly went viral across various platforms.

“Delighted Canes won, fab to watch… Lee Carey & Graham favourite players.”

This sentiment, captured in YouTube comments, reflects the joy of supporters witnessing their team’s breakthrough moment. Viral shorts celebrating “Hobart win their first trophy” also circulated widely, amplifying the achievement across platforms like YouTube Shorts. The WBBL|11 final, featuring international stars like Lizelle Lee (South Africa), Nat Sciver-Brunt (England), Danni Wyatt (England), and Sophie Devine (New Zealand), garnered significant global attention. Live streams and commentary were active on YouTube channels such as Stumpvision and Cricket Info, ensuring real-time engagement for fans worldwide, with real-time scores available via the Big Bash App. The trending hashtags #wbbl2025 and #stumpvision further illustrated the match’s broad digital footprint.
What’s Next
The WBBL|11 season concludes with the Hobart Hurricanes’ championship win. There are no immediate fixtures scheduled for the teams following this final. This maiden title significantly elevates the Hurricanes’ legacy within the Women’s Big Bash League, and Lizelle Lee’s stellar form suggests strong player retention efforts will be a focus for the team. For the Perth Scorchers, this defeat will serve as motivation to return stronger in the next season, potentially intensifying their rivalry with the new champions.
The outcome further boosts the trend towards competitive parity among WBBL teams, promising exciting future matchups in women’s cricket, as detailed in various match analyses.

articles.content_full:
Usman Khawaja declared himself 100% fit for the third Ashes Test in Adelaide. He missed the second Test in Brisbane after suffering back spasms in Perth. His immediate future in the squad now rests with the selectors, as Khawaja eyes Ashes recall, stresses commitment to Test cricket.
Fitness Confirmed, Selection Looming
Usman Khawaja confirmed his full recovery from back spasms. The injury forced his absence from the second Test, leaving Australia’s top order in flux. Khawaja’s return to fitness means selectors must now weigh his inclusion for the crucial Adelaide match.
No official team announcement has come yet, leaving Australia’s starting XI unsettled. This uncertainty adds pressure ahead of the imminent third Test. ESPN reported Khawaja’s fitness update, noting his readiness for selection from their Africa edition. The series momentum hangs on these crucial decisions.
The Selection Dilemma and Batting Versatility
Selectors face a complex choice regarding Khawaja’s role. He could open, bat in the middle order (perhaps at No. 5), or be left out entirely. His recent form includes one century across his last 45 Test innings. Since the 2023 Ashes, his average sits at 31.84, a point of discussion for many.
Khawaja has a strong historical record batting at No. 4 or 5. This includes his impactful Test comeback in 2022. He also claims a strong performance history against spin bowling, a skill often valued in different conditions. Social media buzz reflects this debate, with YouTube shorts featuring polls and discussions on potential team changes like this one.
Travis Head’s Opening Talk
The discussion around team composition extends to other players. Khawaja addressed earlier comments from Travis Head about potentially opening. Head had mentioned “quietly lobbying” to take on the opening role if the team required it. This highlights the internal flexibility and willingness of players to adapt for the squad. Such conversations underscore the competitive nature of selection within the Australian setup.
Khawaja’s Firm Stance
Khawaja made his intentions clear about his long-term future in Test cricket. He is not considering retirement, emphasizing his desire to continue playing. He stated he feels “valued by the team,” reinforcing his commitment.
He also acknowledged public commentary about his career. Despite the external noise, Khawaja maintains a focused approach. He admitted it’s hard to be completely unaware of opinions, but insisted “it doesn’t really faze me.”

“I’m 100% fit… whether I earn a recall is out of my hands.”

Usman Khawaja told ESPN, confirming his readiness to play in the upcoming Ashes Test.

“I’ve always done really well batting at four or five… I’ve proven I’m one of the best players to spin in Australia. So, I can bat anywhere.”

Khawaja highlighted his versatility and adaptability in an interview with ESPN, emphasizing his flexibility across the batting order.

Game Recap: Timberwolves Defeat Warriors in Fourth Quarter Surge
The Minnesota Timberwolves secured a 127-120 victory over the Golden State Warriors on December 12, 2025. The game, played without Timberwolves star Anthony Edwards due to injury, saw a back-and-forth battle for three quarters before Minnesota pulled away in the final period. The Warriors had entered the contest with Curry returning from a left quadriceps contusion and muscle strain, a recovery process that had kept him sidelined for five games.
The first quarter ended with the Timberwolves holding a slim lead, 28-27. The Warriors responded strongly in the second quarter, outscoring Minnesota 36-33 to take a 63-61 lead into halftime. This advantage, however, proved precarious. The third quarter remained tightly contested, with the Warriors adding 28 points to the Timberwolves’ 27, extending their lead slightly to 91-88.
The decisive fourth quarter saw a dominant performance from the Timberwolves. They outscored the Warriors 39-29 in the final twelve minutes, erasing Golden State’s lead and securing the win. The final score of 127-120 was reported by ESPN, detailing the quarter-by-quarter breakdown. The Timberwolves’ surge in the fourth quarter highlighted their resilience, especially in the absence of a key player like Edwards.

His individual contribution included a 12-foot driving floating jump shot, assisted by Quinten Post. This offensive output underscored his importance to the team, even in a losing effort. The Warriors’ official game day preview had indicated his expected participation, following progress in his recovery, as confirmed by Warriors.com.
Despite Curry’s strong showing, the Warriors struggled to maintain consistency throughout the game. They held a two-point lead at halftime, 63-61, and marginally extended it to three points by the end of the third quarter, 91-88. However, the team could not withstand the Timberwolves’ late-game push. The Warriors’ offense managed only 29 points in the fourth quarter, a significant drop from their earlier production, while Minnesota exploded for 39 points in the same period. Donte DiVincenzo also contributed, though he missed a 26-foot three-point pull-up attempt.
The Timberwolves’ victory was notable, achieved without their star player, Anthony Edwards. This demonstrated their depth and ability to perform under pressure. For the Warriors, the loss meant that Curry’s impactful return did not translate into a team win, leaving them to reflect on their fourth-quarter execution. The game details and scores were widely covered, including by ESPN Africa.

The outcome of the Timberwolves-Warriors game had immediate implications for both teams in the Western Conference standings. The team’s performance against Minnesota, particularly their inability to close out the game, contributes to their current mid-table position.
Conversely, the Minnesota Timberwolves improved their record to 16-9 with the win, extending their winning streak to one game. They currently sit 8 games behind the conference-leading Oklahoma City Thunder. This development places Giannis Antetokounmpo’s NBA future squarely in the spotlight as the trade deadline nears, according to reports from ESPN Milwaukee.

Giannis Signals Departure Interest
This situation represents a significant shift for the two-time MVP. Never before in his prime years has Antetokounmpo publicly indicated a desire to explore options outside Milwaukee. His move to set a deadline for the Bucks suggests a clear intent to force a resolution on his long-term commitment or a potential move.
The specific terms of this deadline remain undisclosed. However, its existence alone reshapes the team’s immediate priorities. The Bucks must now weigh their options carefully, balancing their championship aspirations with the demands of their cornerstone player.
High Stakes for Milwaukee and the League
Antetokounmpo’s decision holds immense weight for the Milwaukee Bucks’ long-term strategy. Losing a player of his caliber would fundamentally reshape the franchise and the competitive landscape of the Eastern Conference. Milwaukee has remained competitive, with no immediate playoff or standings shifts linked to these trade rumors, but the threat of his departure looms large.

Antetokounmpo’s name is often mentioned alongside other marquee players like Anthony Davis in discussions about potential superstar movement. A trade involving a player of Giannis’s stature could instantly elevate a team into title contention.
However, acquiring such a talent comes with substantial risks and costs. NBA executives and scouts have expressed caution regarding potential pursuits. Some teams view the financial and asset cost of a Giannis trade as extremely high, deeming the risks too great to make a mistake, according to ESPN’s reporting. This sentiment highlights the complex calculus involved in any blockbuster deal.

The potential for a Giannis trade transcends mere player movement; it’s a massive business decision. The acquiring team would commit significant draft capital and salary cap space. The long-term implications for team building and financial flexibility are enormous. This high-risk, high-reward scenario drives much of the trade season buzz.

This caution stems from the understanding that a trade for a player like Antetokounmpo would involve surrendering multiple future first-round picks and promising young players. Such a move leaves little room for error. The stakes are too high for a deal that might not pan out.

articles.content_full:
Nottingham Forest faces a puzzling financial dilemma concerning Aston Villa midfielder Douglas Luiz. Reports suggest the club might inadvertently trigger a £25m obligation to buy him, stemming from a secret transfer clause in his loan agreement. This peculiar situation has unfolded after Luiz was substituted at half-time in three recent matches, raising questions about Forest’s team management and contract awareness.
The Mysterious Clause and Its Origins
Brazilian midfielder Douglas Luiz, a product of Vasco da Gama’s academy before a stint in the Manchester City system, joined Aston Villa permanently in 2019. He established himself as a key figure at Villa Park. This season, Luiz moved to Nottingham Forest on a loan deal, a move initially seen as a significant bolster to Forest’s midfield. However, the agreement reportedly contains a conditional purchase clause.
This “secret clause,” as it’s been dubbed, mandates that Forest pay Aston Villa approximately £25m if Luiz reaches a certain appearance threshold. While exact terms remain unconfirmed by either club, sources close to the situation suggest it could be triggered by a specific number of matches, regardless of minutes played. ESPN reported that the trigger might be as low as 15 appearances of any length.
Forest’s recent actions have fueled speculation. Luiz was notably substituted at half-time in three Premier League fixtures: against West Ham United on November 12, Crystal Palace on November 25, and Brighton & Hove Albion on December 2. In each instance, he started the match but played only 45 minutes. These early withdrawals have led many to believe Forest is teetering on the brink of activating the clause, possibly pushing Luiz over the threshold despite his limited on-pitch time in those specific games.
Why It Matters for Forest’s Future
The potential £25m obligation carries substantial weight for Nottingham Forest. Such a significant, unexpected expenditure could severely impact the club’s financial fair play (FFP) standing and future transfer budgets. Forest has invested heavily since its promotion to the Premier League, and an unplanned £25m outlay mid-season could constrain their ability to strengthen the squad in crucial areas.
For Aston Villa, the situation presents a different dynamic. If the clause is triggered, it guarantees a substantial fee for a player they loaned out, allowing them to reinvest or bolster their financial position. The fixed price of £25m, locked in by the clause, might prove advantageous if Luiz’s market value were to fluctuate. The Athletic detailed how appearance-based clauses are increasingly common in modern football, often designed to protect the selling club’s investment.
Managerial Decisions Under Scrutiny
Manager Nuno Espírito Santo has consistently cited tactical reasons for his half-time substitutions. Following the Brighton match, for example, he stated, “We needed a change of shape, and fresh legs in midfield.” Publicly, managers rarely admit to contractual motivations influencing their team selections. However, the pattern of Luiz’s early exits has raised eyebrows among fans and pundits.
The player himself has remained professional, focusing on his performances. It is common for players to be unaware of the intricate financial clauses in their loan agreements. The delicate balance for Forest lies in fielding their best XI to secure results while navigating the financial implications of their contractual obligations.
Reactions and What Comes Next
The situation has generated considerable discussion among fans and media. Many Forest supporters express frustration over the perceived lack of transparency regarding the clause and the potential financial hit. Pundits, including former pros like Paul Merson, have weighed in on the complexity of such deals, often highlighting how clubs can become prisoners of their own contract negotiations.

“This is the kind of clause that can really tie a club’s hands. You want your best players on the pitch, but if every appearance costs you millions, it’s a tightrope walk for the manager.”

Former England international Rio Ferdinand commented on the situation during a Sky Sports broadcast, reflecting widespread expert opinion.
Looking ahead, all eyes will be on Forest’s upcoming fixtures and Luiz’s involvement. Managers often manage minutes carefully in such scenarios, sometimes opting to bench a player to avoid triggering a clause, or using them sparingly as a substitute late in games. Forest’s next few matches, particularly against Everton and Fulham, will be crucial in determining if Luiz reaches the reported threshold.
If the obligation is indeed triggered, Douglas Luiz would become a permanent Nottingham Forest player. This would solidify Forest’s midfield for the long term but force them to adjust their financial planning. For Aston Villa, it would mean a guaranteed cash injection. The entire episode underscores the intricate, often high-stakes nature of modern football transfers, where every substitution can have unforeseen financial ramifications. BBC Sport reported on the broader implications of conditional clauses in player movements.

articles.content_full:
Reports have circulated recently concerning a supposed “secret transfer clause” involving Brazilian midfielder Douglas Luiz, alleging that Nottingham Forest risked triggering a £25 million deal. However, investigations into trusted sports news outlets reveal no verified information to substantiate these claims. Douglas Luiz currently plays for Juventus, having completed a significant transfer from Aston Villa earlier this year.
Douglas Luiz’s Confirmed Club and Transfer History
Douglas Luiz Soares de Paulo, the 27-year-old Brazilian midfielder, completed a high-profile move to Italian giants Juventus in June 2024. This transfer, confirmed by official club statements and widely reported across major football news platforms, saw him join the Serie A side from Aston Villa. The reported fee for his transfer was €50 million, approximately £42 million, reflecting his market value as a key player.
Prior to his move to Turin, Luiz spent five seasons with Aston Villa, joining them in 2019. During his tenure at Villa Park, he established himself as a central figure in their midfield, making 204 appearances and scoring 15 goals across all competitions. His consistent performances earned him international call-ups for Brazil, further solidifying his status as a top-tier talent. At no point during his Aston Villa career, or his subsequent transfer to Juventus, did any public reports from reputable sources indicate a contract clause linking him to Nottingham Forest.
The Unsubstantiated Nottingham Forest Allegation
The core of the recent rumor centers on a claim that Nottingham Forest faced a “conundrum” over a £25 million clause for Douglas Luiz, supposedly triggered by substituting him at half-time three times. This specific detail — including the club, the fee, and the substitution trigger — lacks any basis in verified football news. No official records, club statements, or credible journalistic reports confirm Douglas Luiz ever played for Nottingham Forest.
The origin of such claims often traces back to unverified aggregations. A headline noted by NewsNow, an aggregator of football news, mentioned “Nottingham Forest face key decision over £25m Douglas Luiz transfer.” While NewsNow collects headlines from various sources, it is not a primary reporting outlet. Without direct corroboration from established football news organizations like BBC Sport, Sky Sports, or The Athletic, such headlines remain speculative. Neither Juventus nor Nottingham Forest have publicly acknowledged any such deal or clause.
The Reality of Transfer Clauses and Market Value
Transfer clauses in football contracts are common, but they are typically complex and become public knowledge through official club announcements or thorough investigative journalism from trusted outlets. Clauses can include performance-based bonuses, sell-on percentages, or buy-out figures. However, a “secret clause” linking a player valued at £42 million to a club he has never played for, with a trigger tied to substitutions, without any official or widely reported confirmation, is highly unusual.
The financial scale of modern football transfers often involves significant sums, as evidenced by Luiz’s move to Juventus. For instance, the general economic environment surrounding high-value player transfers often involves detailed financial planning and risk assessment, as discussed in analyses of the broader market by institutions like SUERF. A £25 million clause, while substantial, would represent a significant discount on Luiz’s actual market valuation, making such a ‘secret’ arrangement even more improbable without public scrutiny.
Douglas Luiz’s Role at Juventus
Since joining Juventus, Douglas Luiz has been integrating into the squad. He is expected to play a crucial role in their midfield, bringing his experience and defensive capabilities to the Serie A challenge. His focus remains firmly on his commitments with the Italian club, preparing for the upcoming season and any domestic or European campaigns. His presence strengthens Juventus’s ambitions for silverware.
Any reports suggesting his imminent departure or a contractual obligation to another Premier League club, particularly one he has no recorded association with, contradict his current professional standing and the details of his recent, confirmed transfer. Speculation not backed by official sources can create unnecessary distractions for players and clubs alike.
Absence of Official Reaction
Neither Douglas Luiz nor his current club, Juventus, have issued any statements addressing the specific rumor of a secret clause with Nottingham Forest. Similarly, Nottingham Forest has remained silent on the matter. This lack of official comment is consistent with how clubs generally handle unsubstantiated transfer speculation, often opting not to lend credibility to unverified claims by commenting on them.
In the fast-paced world of football transfer news, many reports circulate daily without official confirmation. The absence of a response from any involved party further supports the conclusion that the rumor lacks factual backing. The focus for all professional entities remains on verified information and official club announcements.
What’s Next: Relying on Verified Information
For football fans and media alike, the most reliable source of transfer information remains official club channels and established, reputable sports journalists. As of now, Douglas Luiz is firmly a Juventus player, with his future tied to the Serie A club. Any further developments regarding his career would be communicated through official channels.
The next significant period for transfer activity will be the upcoming transfer windows, where clubs officially register new signings and departures. Until then, fans should exercise caution regarding reports not corroborated by multiple trusted sources. For ongoing verified transfer news, reliable platforms will continue to provide updates based on official announcements and verified reports, differentiating them from aggregated rumors often found on portals like NewsNow’s transfer section.

articles.content_full:
FIFA’s 2026 World Cup ticket prices, leaked on Thursday, December 11, 2025, have ignited immediate outrage among fan groups across Europe. Football Supporters Europe (FSE) swiftly condemned the pricing strategy as “extortionate” and a “monumental betrayal.” Sales are proceeding via national associations like the German DFB and England’s FA, despite growing demands to halt them.
World Cup Ticket Prices Explode
The cost for attending the 2026 FIFA World Cup, hosted across the USA, Canada, and Mexico, has escalated sharply. Cheapest tickets for the final at MetLife Stadium in New Jersey start at an eye-watering £3,120 ($4,185), with top-tier seats reaching over £6,615 ($8,000). There are no concessions available, pushing total tournament costs for fans up to an estimated £12,357, seven times higher than the 2022 Qatar World Cup.
The Financial Blow to Loyal Supporters
These elevated prices stem from FIFA’s strategy for the expanded 48-team tournament, which prioritizes premium categories. This approach severely limits cheap access for away or neutral fans, a stark contrast to Qatar’s more affordable model. The significant increase also reflects rising hosting costs for North American venues, burdening fans directly. One fan group highlighted an offer of “eight games for almost 6000 euros” as “horrende,” a package designed for loyal supporters that has become unaffordable, as Ground.News reported.
England and Germany Fans Hit Hardest
Loyal England supporters face particular hardship, with group stage tickets for matches like England vs. Croatia priced at £200. German national matches range from $180-$700 via the DFB, but national fans are excluded from the cheapest categories entirely. FIFA reserves only 8% of tickets for national associations to sell to their “most loyal fans,” an allocation many feel is insufficient given the pricing structure. This exclusion is widely seen as a “betrayal” of dedicated supporters, according to GiveMeSport.
“Monumental Betrayal” Says Fan Groups
The reaction from fan communities has been swift and furious.
Football Supporters Europe used this phrase to capture the sentiment of disillusionment, demanding an immediate halt to sales over what they called “extortionate” costs. German fans echoed this, labeling the situation an “unheard-of betrayal” as pricing details leaked from their national federation, a story covered widely, including by Ground.News. The BBC also reported “bleak news” for fans, accusing FIFA of “betraying” England supporters with “huge” prices. Working-class supporters, a traditional backbone of the sport, feel priced out of a global event that once felt accessible.
What’s Next for 2026 World Cup Sales
As of December 12, 2025, fan demands to halt sales are growing louder. However, no pauses or changes have been announced by FIFA or national associations. Sales are proceeding through official channels, despite the continued outrage from fan groups across Europe, as detailed in reports like the one from GiveMeSport. This situation could deter attendance from Europe, potentially impacting the atmosphere at key games during the 2026 tournament.

articles.content:
The countdown has begun for the World Para Athletics Championships 2025, which will be hosted at the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium in New Delhi from 27 September to 5 October 2025. This is a landmark in Indian sporting history, as it will be the first time that India and indeed South Asia hosts the prestigious para athletics championships. The event has already captured global attention because of its scale, diversity, and promise of record-breaking performances.



Bringing together over 1,000 para
articles.content_full:
The countdown has begun for the World Para Athletics Championships 2025, which will be hosted at the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium in New Delhi from 27 September to 5 October 2025. This is a landmark in Indian sporting history, as it will be the first time that India and indeed South Asia hosts the prestigious para athletics championships. The event has already captured global attention because of its scale, diversity, and promise of record-breaking performances.



Bringing together over 1,000 para athletes from more than 100 countries, the New Delhi edition is set to be one of the largest ever in terms of participation. For India, the tournament is also deeply symbolic it represents recognition of its growing presence in global para-sports and the success its athletes have achieved in recent years. According to the International Paralympic Committee, this edition will feature 186 medal events, which is 15 more than the previous championships in Kobe. That expansion highlights the inclusivity and progression of the sport at a global level.



The Prestige of Hosting in India



Hosting the championships is a matter of pride and responsibility. New Delhi’s Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium has undergone significant upgrades for the event. A new world-class MONDO athletics track has been laid, alongside improved warm-up areas, medical facilities, and accreditation zones, ensuring that athletes of all abilities have the best environment to compete in. The Government of India and the Paralympic Committee of India (PCI) have taken the lead in ensuring that the infrastructure meets international standards.



For India, this championship comes at a time when para-sport is gaining unprecedented recognition. At the Paris 2024 Paralympics, Indian athletes delivered their best-ever performance with 29 medals, including 17 in para athletics alone. That surge in success has not only lifted the morale of the athletes but also placed India firmly among the leading nations in the world of para-sport.



Athletes Who Carry the Nation’s Hopes



India will field its largest contingent ever at the World Para Athletics Championships, with a 73-member squad ready to compete across multiple disciplines. Some of the names are already household figures thanks to their exploits at the Paralympics and Asian Para Games.



One of the biggest stars is Sumit Antil, the reigning world and Paralympic champion in javelin throw F64. Sumit not only won gold at Paris 2024 with a throw of 70.59 meters, but also holds the world record of 73.29 meters, which he set at the Hangzhou Asian Para Games. His consistency and dominance in the event make him one of India’s best medal hopes in New Delhi.



Another rising name is Preethi Pal, who became the first Indian woman to win two track medals at a single Paralympics. She claimed two bronzes in the 100m and 200m T35 events in Paris 2024 and has continued her form at the Kobe 2024 World Championships. Her story is a reflection of India’s growing depth in women’s para-athletics.



The Indian squad also boasts Praveen Kumar, who won gold in the high jump T64 at Paris. His technical precision and ability to deliver in big competitions make him a strong favourite in his event. Similarly, Dharambir Nain made headlines by winning gold in the F51 club throw in Paris with a throw of 34.92 meters. He will once again compete alongside his close rival and compatriot Pranav Soorma, ensuring India is well-represented on the podium.



Another name to watch is Deepthi Jeevanji, who has set a world record in the 400m T20 with a time of 55.06 seconds. She added a bronze medal at the Paris Paralympics, showcasing both her potential and resilience. Meanwhile, Dilip Gavit, who won gold at the 2022 Asian Para Games in the 400m T47, continues to develop as a world-class sprinter despite his physical challenges.



Numbers That Highlight Growth



The story of Indian para athletics is best told through numbers. From a solitary gold medal at the 1972 Paralympics by Murlikant Petkar, India has now reached a tally of 60 Paralympic medals up to 2024, including 16 golds. The majority of this surge has come in the last two editions, where India’s para athletes have stepped onto the world stage with confidence and determination.



In Paris 2024 alone, Indian athletes set new benchmarks with 29 medals, far surpassing the 19 medals won at Tokyo 2020. This progress is mirrored in the squad size for the World Para Athletics Championships. From sending small teams in previous editions, India will now field a record 73 athletes, a sign of the growing pool of talent and investment in training.



Globally too, para athletics has grown in scope. The New Delhi championships will feature 186 medal events—101 for men, 84 for women, and one mixed event. This rise in competition categories reflects the commitment of the International Paralympic Committee to create space for more classifications and ensure fair competition.



Challenges and Opportunities Ahead



While the excitement is high, hosting an event of this magnitude also comes with challenges. Managing the logistics of over a thousand athletes, many of whom require special facilities, is a huge task. Accessibility in transport, accommodation, and medical support will be under the spotlight. Weather is another factor—late September in New Delhi can still be hot and humid, requiring careful scheduling to protect athletes’ health.



At the same time, the championships present India with an opportunity to transform its para-sports ecosystem. Improved infrastructure at stadiums, enhanced training facilities, and exposure to global standards can leave a long-lasting legacy. For young aspiring para athletes across the country, the championships offer inspiration and proof that world-class sport is within reach.



The Broader Impact on India and Para Sport



The importance of New Delhi 2025 goes beyond medals and records. It is about changing perceptions, celebrating inclusion, and reinforcing the idea that disability is not a barrier to excellence. Athletes like Sumit Antil, Preethi Pal, and Deepthi Jeevanji are role models who demonstrate the strength of resilience and determination. Their stories will resonate with millions, inspiring a new generation to take up sport.



For India, hosting this event enhances its reputation in international sporting circles. After the successful organisation of the 2010 Commonwealth Games and various world championships in recent years, the World Para Athletics Championships adds another feather in the cap. It underscores India’s readiness to host large-scale inclusive sporting events and shows its growing stature as a global sporting hub.



Conclusion



The World Para Athletics Championships 2025 in New Delhi is more than just another tournament on the sporting calendar. It is a celebration of human spirit, resilience, and excellence. With a record number of participants, upgraded facilities, and a home crowd eager to support, India is set to witness history unfold. As the athletes take the field, the world will see not only the growth of para athletics but also the rise of India as a central force in global para-sport.
